coref: A man who lived a long time ago believed that A man who lived a long time ago could read the future in the stars. A man who lived a long time ago called A man who lived a long time ago an Astrologer, and spent A man who lived a long time ago time at night gazing at the sky. One evening A man who lived a long time ago was walking along the open road outside the village. A man who lived a long time ago eyes were fixed on the stars. A man who lived a long time ago thought A man who lived a long time ago saw there that the end of the world was at hand, when all at once, down A man who lived a long time ago went into a hole full of mud and water. There A man who lived a long time ago stood up to A man who lived a long time ago ears, in the muddy water, and madly clawing at the slippery sides of the hole in A man who lived a long time ago effort to climb out. A man who lived a long time ago cries for help soon brought the villagers running. As the villagers pulled A man who lived a long time ago out of the mud, one of the villagers said: You pretend to read the future in the stars, and yet you fail to see what is at your feet! This may teach you to pay more attention to what is right in front of you, and let the future take care of care. What use is it, said another, to read the stars, when you can't see what's right here on the earth?
